page.title: 20Conclusion.
page.content: During one lifetime the way of life of people in this area has changed dramatically.Generations of families worked on the land.Modern technology has changed that.Labour intensive farming has given way to mechanised farms run by one or two men.At the same time transport has improved beyond anything imaginable a hundred years ago enabling people to commute daily to London or Bristol.Televised local and national news bulletins have replaced the shared newspaper which took a week to be passed around the community,having been brought from Chippenham by a Nestles worker.The ownership of the land has changed from the vast Draycott Estate to a number of individuals.People no longer need to be servile.This community is very much part of the modern world.
